name: Retablo:  Santa Lucia
description:
This retablo is from Season 2 of New Mexican Santera to air starting sometime in January.  The finished DVD will be included with the sale of the item as soon as editing is completed.

The finished piece is available at TINtero Gallery in Old Town Albuquerque.  In the event that the item is sold at the time of online purchase, money will be promptly refunded.

Original design and construction of tin frame by Jason Younis y Delgado.

name: Retablo in Tin: San Francisco blue
description:
ST FRANCIS OF ASSISI [SAN FRANCISCO] 
1181-1226AD 

Feast Day Oct 4 

Patron Saint of the city of Santa Fe, the environment, families & animals 

The son of a wealthy cloth merchant, Francis searched for meaning in his life and was moved by the goodness of the Church. He surrendered all of his worldly possessions and vowed a life of poverty in devotion to God, unknowingly founding the Franciscan order of monks. He received the marks of Stigmata, appearing only on the most devout of followers. He is often shown with the marks. He may be shown with skull, cross, animals. He will have three knots on his rope belt signifying the three vows of his order: poverty, chastity, obedience.

This piece features the Francisco Classic tin frame design originated and named after our great-great grandfather, Francisco Delgado and recreated here by Sean's brother, Jason Younis y Delgado.  

The retablo depicts the traditional blue monks cloth and halo and shows Saint Francis holding the traditional skull and cross symbols.  Saint Francis is surrounded by birds and a coyote, symbolizing the wolf from a famous parable where he rescues a village from an insidious wolf by communing with the wolf and asking the town to feed the wolf.    

Hand-made gesso, natural pigments and watercolors. This item is currently available at Tintero Gallery 306 San Felipe St NW in Old Town, Albuquerque, so there is a possibility the item might be sold out in which case payment will be promptly refunded.

Measures approx 10" x 15" overall.

name: Retablo in Tin: Sagrada Corazón
description:
The retablo is from Season 2 of New Mexican Santera to air starting sometime in January.



Tin frame by Jason Younis y Delgado.

name: Retablo in Tin:  San Francisco
description:
ST FRANCIS OF ASSISI [SAN FRANCISCO] 
1181-1226AD 

Feast Day Oct 4 

Patron Saint of the city of Santa Fe, the environment, families & animals 

The son of a wealthy cloth merchant, Francis searched for meaning in his life and was moved by the goodness of the Church. He surrendered all of his worldly possessions and vowed a life of poverty in devotion to God, unknowingly founding the Franciscan order of monks. He received the marks of Stigmata, appearing only on the most devout of followers. He is often shown with the marks. He may be shown with skull, cross, animals. He will have three knots on his rope belt signifying the three vows of his order: poverty, chastity, obedience.

This piece features complex tin frame by Sean's brother, Jason Younis y Delgado based on the design of Jason's great-great grandfather, Francisco Delgado referred to as "Francisco Classic" style.  

The retablo depicts Saint Francis holding the traditional skull and cross symbols, surrounded by gentle woodland creatures who reflect his gentle spirit.

Hand-made gesso, natural pigments and watercolors. This item is currently available at Tintero Gallery 306 San Felipe St NW in Old Town, Albuquerque, so there is a possibility the item might be sold out in which case payment will be promptly refunded.

Measures approx 12" x 16" overall.

name: Retablo in Tin: San Sebastian
description: This piece is from Season 2 of New Mexican Santera to air starting sometime in January.

name: Retablo & TIn:  Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe
description:
OUR LADY OF GUADALUPE 1531 A.D. | Feast Day Dec 12 

Marian Image 

A humble local named Juan Diego claimed to have been visited by the Virgin Mary. The local Bishop requested a sign. Juan Diego returned (on what is now her Feast Day) with a gift of blooming roses that had appeared in mid winter on the hill where the apparition spoke to him. He carried the flowers in his cloak and as he spilled them out for the Bishop, the image of the Virgin appeared on his cloak just as Juan Diego had described her. The Bishop fell to his knees and built a chapel on the hill. The cloak still hangs today in a shrine on the original hill. 

The image has come to represent the worldly love and peace that Mary has to offer, crossing ethnic boundaries.

This piece is framed by a bold tin plate by Sean's brother, Jason Younis y Delgado.

Hand-made gesso, natural pigments and watercolors.  This item is currently available at Tintero Gallery 306 San Felipe St NW in Old Town, Albuquerque, so there is a possibility the item might be sold out in which case payment will be promptly refunded.  

Retablo measures approx 7" x 10".  Total approx 14" x 18"

name: Retablo: Large San Pascual
description:
Patron Saint of the kitchen and cooks, this is a new style for me inspired by the memory of a piece by Dean Delgado.  

This retablo was painted on New Mexican Santera Season 2 and will come with a DVD of me painting the project!

I really wanted pure joy in his face and am pleased with the results.  San Pascual is busy preparing a delicious feast of frijoles, tortillas and pan, the pleasures of a simple monk.

Hand-made gesso, natural pigments and watercolors.  This item is currently available at Tintero Gallery 306 San Felipe St NW in Old Town, Albuquerque, so there is a possibility the item might be sold out in which case payment will be promptly refunded.  

Measures approx 12" x 16".

name: Retablo:  Saint Michael 001
description:
This retablo was painted on New Mexican Santera Season 1 and will come with a DVD of me painting the project!  The retablo includes bold blue accents and original carving.

SAINT MICHAEL [SAN MIGUEL] Feast Day Sept 29 

Patron of artists, bakers, grocers, mariners, paratroopers, police, EMT’s, haberdashers, bankers. 

Invoked against sickness. 

As Prince of the Seraphim, he led the charge to defend against the uprising of the betrayal of Lucifer, then angel. Although called upon to defend the Church throughout time in various battles, it is not for his military strength that he is revered most, but for his healing powers offering miracle healing at several fonts and occassions. His name translates to, “Who is Like God?,” signifying his humilty at the feet of the Almighty. Scales represent his weighing of the souls of Man upon judgement day. His angelic wings imply his swiftness and his sword his strength.

Invoked against fire and lightning.

Dimensions: 6 1/2" x 12"

All images and text copyright 
©2011 Sean Wells y Delgado
www.Delgadoarts.com

name: Retablo:  Alma de Maria
description:
THE SOUL OF MARY [ALMA DE MARIA]
Mother to the Son of God, Mary represents unconditional love and has several iconic representations of her.

The “Alma de Maria” image explores Mary’s gentle spirit and tenderness. The dove, always depicted near her heart, represents the Visitation of the Holy Spirit. The lilies represent her purity, declared in Edict by Pope Pius IX in 1854, which deems She was born without the mark of Original Sin, an “Immaculate Conception,” and was in a state of perpetual virginity when having given birth to the Christ Child. The roses are reflections of Mary’s association with the rosary and the Crown of Thorns that Jesus wore upon His Crucifixion.

This piece features tin channel frame by Sean's brother, Jason Younis y Delgado

Hand-made gesso, natural pigments and watercolors. This item is currently available at Tintero Gallery 306 San Felipe St NW in Old Town, Albuquerque, so there is a possibility the item might be sold out in which case payment will be promptly refunded.

Measures approx 10" x 14".

name: Ornament: La Conquistadora
description:
Hand-painted retablito based on an original rubber stamp designed by Sean using traditional techniques and natural pigments. Each one will vary in style, shape and detailing. 

The ornament comes with an informative gift tag that highlights the unusual story behind La Conquistadora, the most continuously venerated statue of the Virgin Mary in the United States.  

Each ornament comes in a lovely protective organza gift pouch.

Featured on Encantada TV Stamped Retablo Ornament video (also available for purchase). 

Protectress of the City of Santa Fe.

Dimensions: Approx. 1 1/2" x 1 1/2"

All images and text copyright ©2011 Sean Wells y Delgado
www.Delgadoarts.com

name: Ornament Doña Sebastiana
description:
This unusual retablo ornament is painted with natural pigments on a pine board primed with hand-made gesso.  The base image is stamped from Sean's original design and then overpainted with loving detail.

The ornament comes in an organza bag with hang tag explaining the history of retablo painting and the Doña Sebastiana image.

Measures approx. 2" x 3"

LADY SEBASTIAN [DOÑA SEBASTIANA]
An unusual non-Saint image, the Doña is the only muerto (death) image found in traditional retablo iconography. The origins of Sebastiana are unclear. Historically, Sebastiana was a nearly life size skeleton figure carved of wood that rode upon a rustic wooden cart. The cart was loaded with stones (presumably representing the souls or burdens of man) and pulled by the Penitentes, a religious group of monks known for acts of public suffering as penance. The female figure often had actual human hair integrated and carries a bow, perhaps in some tie to her namesake, Saint Sebastian who is shown impaled by multiple arrows.

name: Ornament: Saint Francis
description:
Hand-painted retablito based on an original rubber stamp designed by Sean using traditional techniques and natural pigments. Each one will vary in style, shape and detailing. 

The ornament comes with an informative gift tag that highlights the life of Saint Francis.  

Each ornament comes in a lovely protective organza gift pouch.

Featured on Encantada TV Stamped Retablo Ornament Video (also available for purchase). 

Patron Saint of the environment, families, birds and the City of Santa Fe.

Dimensions: Approx. 1 1/2" x 2"

All images and text copyright ©2011 Sean Wells y Delgado
www.Delgadoarts.com

name: DVD Introduction To Retablo Painting Individual Saints
description:
In these episodes from TV's New Mexican Santera, 5th generation Spanish Colonial Artisan Sean Wells y Delgado introduces the regional and historic artform of retablo painting through a series of projects.

Overhead camera view let the viewer follow along. You'll find technical information, stories on the history of retablos and the Saints and visual fun! Entertaining whether you have an interest in the art, the history or the stories of the Saints.

SEASON 1
VOL 1 Introduction To Retablo Painting
VOL 2 Saint Rita (Married Women, Hopeless Causes)
VOL 3 Saint Francis (Families & Animals)
VOL 4 Saint Barbara (Imminent Explosions)
VOL 5 Saint Michael (Healing)

SEASON 2
VOL 6 Saint Sebastian (coming soon)
VOL 7 Saint Lucy (coming soon)
VOL 8 San Pascual (coming soon)

SEASON 3
VOL 9 San Antonio (Lost Items)
VOL 10 Santo Niño de Atocha (Prisoners)
VOL 11 Santa Apollonia (Dentists & Teeth)
VOL 12 San Ysidro (Farmers & Crops)

Volume 1 [Episode 1-2] Introduction to the Spanish Colonial Arts, the background of retablo making, board selection and traditional gesso.

name: DVD Volume 2 Introduction To Retablo Painting: St Rita
description:
In these compiled episodes from Encantada TV's New Mexican Santera, 5th generation Spanish Colonial Artisan Sean Wells y Delgado introduces the regional and historic artform of retablo painting through a series of projects.

Overhead camera view let the viewer follow along. You'll find technical information, stories on the history of retablos and the Saints and visual fun! Entertaining whether you have an interest in the art, the history or the stories of the Saints.

In this SECOND VOLUME, Sean takes you through the first retablo project, Saint Rita.  It opens with an introduction to pigments and brushes.  Then, Sean walks you through the process of painting a basic retablo as she discusses the interesting story of Saint Rita of Cascia.

The retablo featured in this volume is still available.  http://delgadoarts.bigcartel.com/product/st-rita-de-cascia-003

SAINT RITA OF CASCIA [SANTA RITA]
1381-1457 A.D. Feast Day May 22 

Patroness of lost causes, marriage; against infertility, abuse, infidelity 

Arranged to marry at age 12, she suffered abuse from her spouse. She bore him 2 sons who were corrupted by their father. Although a dedicated wife and mother, she always maintained her faith. After 18 years, she convinced her husband to repent. But, it was too late to save his life. He was killed by his enemies. The sons sought revenge and Rita convinced them to set aside their hate. They died of natural causes within the year. She was then accepted to the convent at Cascia where she served with acts of goodness for the remainder of her life. She suffered a stigmata, a permanent wound on her forehead said to be from the crown of
thorns from Christ’s crucifixion.

name: DVD Volume 3 Introduction to Retablo Painting:  St Francis
description:
In these compiled episodes from Encantada TV's New Mexican Santera, 5th generation Spanish Colonial Artisan Sean Wells y Delgado introduces the regional and historic artform of retablo painting through a series of projects.

Overhead camera view let the viewer follow along. You'll find technical information, stories on the history of retablos and the Saints and visual fun! Entertaining whether you have an interest in the art, the history or the stories of the Saints.

In this THIRD VOLUME, Sean begins a slightly more advanced image, introducing border and other character elements.  Saint Francis' delightful tales unfold as the painting evolves.


ST FRANCIS OF ASSISI [SAN FRANCISCO] 
1181-1226AD Feast Day Oct 4 

Patron Saint of the city of Santa Fe, the environment, families & animals 

The son of a wealthy cloth merchant, Francis searched for meaning in his life and was moved by the goodness of the Church. He surrendered all of his worldly possessions and vowed a life of poverty in devotion to God, unknowingly founding the Franciscan order of monks. He received the marks of Stigmata, appearing only on the most devout of followers. He is often shown with the marks. He may be shown with skull, cross, animals. He will have three knots on his rope belt signifying the three vows of his order: poverty, chastity, obedience.

name: DVD Volume 4 Introduction to Retablo Painting: St Barbara
description:
In these compiled episodes from Encantada TV's New Mexican Santera, 5th generation Spanish Colonial Artisan Sean Wells y Delgado introduces the regional and historic artform of retablo painting through a series of projects.

Overhead camera view let the viewer follow along. You'll find technical information, stories on the history of retablos and the Saints and visual fun! Entertaining whether you have an interest in the art, the history or the stories of the Saints.

In this FOURTH VOLUME, Sean explores the captivating iconography of Saint Barbara.  Her unusual Saint story compliment the rich colors and details of this retablo.

SAINT BARBARA [SANTA BARBARA] 3RD CENTURY A.D. | Feast Day Dec 4 

Patron those in danger of sudden death from explosives, electricians, firemen and mathematicians. 

Invoked against fire and lightning. Locked in a tower by her father, she found solace in the Bible. She rejected an arranged marriage of a wealthy suitor which insulted her father. In retort, he confessed her to the local magistrate as a practicing Christian. Tortured and threatened with death, she proclaimed her faith. It is said that she could not be burned. Furious and humiliated, her father volunteered to execute the sentence and beheaded his daughter. Upon doing so, he was struck down by lightning and burned to death. She is remembered for placing three windows in her bath house to
signify the Holy Trinity.

name: DVD Volume 5 Introduction to Retablo Painting: St Michael
description:
In these compiled episodes from Encantada TV's New Mexican Santera, 5th generation Spanish Colonial Artisan Sean Wells y Delgado introduces the regional and historic artform of retablo painting through a series of projects.

Overhead camera view let the viewer follow along. You'll find technical information, stories on the history of retablos and the Saints and visual fun! Entertaining whether you have an interest in the art, the history or the stories of the Saints.

In this FIFTH VOLUME, Sean develops the complicated imagery of Saint Michael.  This advanced episode will reflect on the lessons of the season and explore more developed iconography.

SAINT MICHAEL [SAN MIGUEL] Feast Day Sept 29 Patron of artists, bakers, grocers, mariners, paratroopers, police, EMT’s, haberdashers, bankers. Invoked against sickness. As Prince of the Seraphim, he led the charge to defend against the uprising of the betrayal of Lucifer, then angel. Although called upon to defend the Church throughout time in various battles, it is not for his military strength that he is revered most, but for his healing powers offering miracle healing at several fonts and occassions. His name translates to, “Who is Like God?,” signifying his humilty at the feet of the Almighty. Scales represent his weighing of the souls of Man upon judgement day. His angelic wings imply his swiftness and his sword his strength.

name: Ring "La Doña Sebastiana" Rectangular
description:
"La Doña Sebastiana" image from original retablo by Sean Wells y Delgado.  Sean enjoys painting the Doña image to help tell the story of this uniquely New Mexican muerto figure.

Sterling plated approximately 1/2" x 1" adjustable ring. 

Images are edited and printed using a dye-sublimation process to insure longevity.  They are then cut to size and set in clear epoxy resin, a multi-part 24 hour process, but so worth the results!  The meniscus dome of the resin creates a magnifying effect to the image that really animates the piece.  Bubbles are common and part of the unique character of each piece.

The second image is just a reference of size.

Each item comes in a delicate organza bag with gift tag explaining techniques and imagery.

categories.name: Other Design Items from Sean Wells

name: Rings Large Oval
description: These festive rings celebrate the calavera images of Jose Guadaupe Posada and also include my Doña Sebastiana retablo image.  They are a base metal setting with an adjustable band.  The face measures approximately one inch in the long direction making these bold and fun.  I have approximately 3 of each style.  Options listed left to right.

categories.name: Other Design Items from Sean Wells

name: Delgado Family Crest
description:
This original crest is based on the historic features of one variant of the Delgado Family Crest.  It is painted using my traditional color palette and hand-made gesso on a pine board.  Tin accents can be added by Jason Younis y Delgado for an additional charge.  

Measures approximately 7" x 10".

name: Fiesta Of Balloons Coloring Book Gift Set
description: Designed and Illustrated by Sean, this festive coloring book is filled with bold hot air balloon graphics that are fun to color for all ages.  Inspired by the annual International Balloon Fiesta of Albuquerque, the balloons are all drawn from real balloon patterns and designs.  An 11x17 centerfold poster captures the full majesty of the odd Albuquerque skies of September.  Comes with markers in cello wrapping ("gift set"). Images copyright ©2010 Sean Wells.

categories.name: Other Design Items from Sean Wells

name: Decoupage Egg: Our Lady of Guadalupe
description:
I wanted to do something special for Easter.  I only created a small batch of these.  They are porcelain with a gold tone.  The image is a collage of my artwork including an original retablo image and graphic roses.  I have decoupaged the image onto the gold egg.  

Each one is hand made, so they will vary in look and detailing.  I added ornament to some, deckled edging, beading, etc.  Some of the decals are sheer giving them an antique quality and some are more graphic and elaborate (labeled "Modern" below).  All are charming.

Each egg is hand titled and comes in an organza gift pouch with descriptive hang tag.

dimensions:  chicken egg

All images and text copyright ©2011 Sean Wells y Delgado
www.Delgadoarts.com

categories.name: Other Design Items from Sean Wells

name: Gift Set: Retablo Ornament Kit
description:
Paint your very own retablo!  This is a great introduction to the materials and stories of the santero.  This kit is featured on Encatada TV's Stamped Ornament Retablo video. Companion DVD walking you through painting the ornament is also available in the shop.  

Kit Includes 1 pre-stamped ornament, 5 pigments, color guide, 2 brushes, sponge and metal case.  NOT FOR YOUNG CHILDREN.

name: Gift Set: Retablo Ornament Kit & DVD
description:
Stamped retablo ornament kit ($19.95 value) in choice of La Conquistadora image or Saint Francis image PLUS How-To DVD ($12.95 value).  This is a perfect starter set for someone who would like to be introduced to the art of retablo painting.

DVD 45min.

name: DVD How-To Video Stamped Retablo Ornament
description:
This special Holiday episodes from Encantada TV's New Mexican Santera series introduces the art of retablo painting with a fun ornament project using the ornament kit or starting from scratch.  It's a great overview of retablo painting and a fun project even if you don't intend to make one.

Overhead camera view lets the viewer follow along.  You'll find technical information, introduction to the history of retablos and the Saints and visual fun!  

Learn more about individual episodes on the blog www.DelgadoArts.com

name: Starter Set: Natural Pigments Basic
description: Dark Brown, flesh, red, yellow, white, gray (1oz each by weight), dark green (1/4oz by weight), mint green (1/2oz by weight), mica (1oz by volume) and one paint pot of black watercolor for outlining. A selection of natural pigments, oxides and clays hand-selected by Sean.

name: Sampler: Traditional Pigments
description: I made this set so I could take it with me when I travel.  There's enough pigment in these containers to do many, many retablos.  It comes with all the colors in the basic pigments set (dark brown, flesh, gray, white, yellow, red, mint green, sage green) in a convenient package (the same kind of attached paint pots that comes with children's acrylic painting sets).  Here's an affordable way to get a feel for the natural pigments and you can use it for travel, too!

name: Starter Kit: Retablo
description: Starter mini retablo set includes, 2 prestamped ornaments, 2 gessoed boards, 6 pigments, graphite paper (when available), hanging cord selection, black watercolor, sealer, 3 brushes, sgraffito tool

name: Starter Kit:  Retablo + DVDs
description: Starter retablo kit plus Vol 1 & 2 (Episodes 1-5) DVD of New Mexican Santera and Saint Rita pattern! Videos covers everything you need to paint your first retablo.

name: Individual Pigments
description:
Containers of your favorite colors to refill or supplement your sets.  All refills 1 ounce by weight unless otherwise noted.  Select your color:  
• Brick red (oxide)
• Dark brown (clay)
• Flesh (clay)
• White (clay)
• Gray (clay)
• Goldenrod (oxide)
• 1/2 oz Mint green (oxide)
• 1/4 oz Sage green (oxide) 
• Mica flakes (1oz by volume)

name: Mica Flakes
description:
These natural occurring particles are a local mainstay to the region.  Commonly found in and around granite, mica is incorporated into a variety of regional arts & crafts, including the wonderfully practical micaceous clay pottery of the Spanish Colonial Arts tradition.  (See examples at Tintero Gallery in Old Town).  The mica not only adds an enchanting glow to the pottery, but also helps the pottery to retain heat, making it ideal bakeware.  

Mica can be added to your retablo painting either mixed in with the pigment for a subtle shimmer and texture or after the pigment is applied for a more snow-like effect.  

The mica is very light, but for convenience, I'm packaging it in the same containers as the pigments, approximately 1oz by volume.

From Wikipedia:  The word "mica" is derived from the Latin word mica, meaning "a crumb", and probably influenced by micare, "to glitter".

name: Prepared Blank Boards
description:
Pine boards hand-prepared using traditional gesso techniques.  These are finished and ready to paint!  

If you watch my video on gesso making, you will get a sense how labor intensive producing just one board can be.

Choose [4] 3 1/2" x 7" or [2] 5 1/2" x 9".  

Sizes may vary slightly.

name: Sampler: Traditional Gesso
description:
Gesso is a traditional priming base applied to boards.  Traditional gesso, unlike store-bought gesso, is water based and is an ideal surface to receive natural powdered pigments.  This sampler comes with enough supplies to cover approximately 12 medium boards and directions for use.  Includes rabbit skin glue, premixed calcium powders and directions for use.  Includes rabbit skin glue, premixed calcium powders and directions for use. 

Please visit my blog for more information on gesso:

http://delgadoarts.wordpress.com/06-gesso-instructions/
